results.title: The Red dawn
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “History in action”.
In November 1920, the last of the White Army was evacuated which signalled the end of ‘Old Russia’. Millions died and millions were homeless. Industry was wrecked and farms were ruined, but Lenin, leader of the Bolsheviks was able to retain his power through the use of propaganda, charismatic leadership and where necessary, force. This episode focuses on the abdication of Tsar Nicholas and the gaining of power by the Bolsheviks, and includes archival footage.

results.title: From war to revolution
results.creator_credit: John Radcliffe and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History 1917-1967”.
Describes the development of the main opposing forces in China in the period of the civil war and disorder following the 1911 revolution, the war with Japan and the eventual establishment of the Communist regime in 1949.

results.title: Lenin's revolution
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History 1917-1967”.
Describes the background to the Russian revolution of 1917, Lenin’s intentions and policies and the consolidation of the Bolsheviks in power. Commentary by Brian Redhead. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: New China
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History 1917-1967”.
Describes the main developments in China since 1949 - collectivization of land, the communes, the Great Leap Forward, plans for production, the Cultural Revolution and the Red Guard movement.

results.title: The Cold war
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History 1917-1967”.
Describes the origin and development of the hostility between the United States and USSR after 1945, the formation of the system of anti-communist alliances around the world and the respective spheres of influence. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Hitler's challenge
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “History 1917-1967”.
Describes German re-armament, changes in foreign policy, the failure of appeasement, and initial successes of the Blitzkrieg. Presented by Brian Redhead.

results.title: The Rise of Hitler
results.creator_credit: John Radcliffe, BBC-TV and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History 1917-1967”
Describes the peace settlement after the 1914-18 War and its effects in Germany. Discusses the reasons for the rise of Hitler, the nature of his regime and the series of aggressive moves leading to war in 1939.

results.title: A Nuclear Accident
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “High Office”.
There has been an accident at a nuclear power station and a crisis threatens. Examines how the ministers concerned react and what form the ensuing line of inquiry should take. Among those taking part are former Home Secretary Merlyn Rees and former Environment Secretary Peter Shore
